newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's BBV H1 net profit up 23 pct- report.
newsitem.headline: Spain's BBV H1 net profit up 23 pct- report.

text.p: Spain's Banco Bilbao Vizcaya's first half net profit rose 23 percent in the first half of 1997, a report in financial daily Cinco Dias said on Thursday.
But a BBV spokesman declined to confirm the report, which quoted unnamed sources within the company.
"I can't confirm the figures. I can only confirm that we'll be presenting the official results on July 24," he told Reuters.
According to the report, behind the increase in profit was bigger demand for loans.
Cinco Dias added that bank director Jose Ignacio Goirigolzarri said on Wednesday in Barcelona he expected "loan demand and economic activity to increase in the second half (this year)".
On Wednesday BBV shares outperformed the market, rising 3.09 percent versus a 1.02 percent gain in the Ibex-35. It was again outperforming the market in early trade on Thursday.
Market analysts have forecast BBV's net attributable will increase 25.7 percent, according to a Reuters poll.
